qas.question: In what year did Philips institute a laboratory to create a digital audio disc?
What was the proposed diameter for the original compact disc?
What year did Philips propse the idea of a digital audio format?
Who was the director of the Philips audio division in 1974?
What Philips engineer recommended a digital format?

plausible_answers.text: the diagonal of an audio cassette

qas.question: What was the 20cm diameter based on?
What year was the digital audio disc released?
How many engineer recommended the 11.5 cm diameter?
Who was the director of Philips by 1977?

context: In 1974, <a3_0><b4_0><b8_0>L. Ottens<b8_0/><b4_0/><a3_0/>, director of the audio division of Philips, started a small group with the aim to develop an analog optical audio disc with a diameter of 20 cm and a sound quality superior to that of the vinyl record. However, due to the unsatisfactory performance of the analog format, <b7_0>two<b7_0/> Philips research engineers recommended a digital format in March <a2_0>1974<a2_0/>. In <a0_0><b6_0>1977<b6_0/><a0_0/>, Philips then established a laboratory with the mission of creating a digital audio disc. The diameter of Philips's prototype compact disc was set at <a1_0>11.5 cm<a1_0/>, <b5_0>the diagonal of an audio cassette<b5_0/>.
